mdRecord.dcterms:description: The War Salon, showing marble relief of Louis XIV on horseback

A hunting lodge built for King Louis XIII in 1623 was rebuilt with extensive gardens from 1631. Enlarged in 2 main phases: first by Louis Le Vau from 1688; then from 1678 by J.H. Mansart. Interior decorations were carried out under supervision of Charles Le Brun. (GDAO) [work]
